channel.title: Digg Top Stories
channel.description: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

item.title: The Surprising Statistics Of Border Drug Arrests
item.description: While the Border Patrol likes to highlight the capture of Mexican drug mules, they don't make up anywhere near a majority of the people arrested.

item.title: Italy Orders Retrial Of Amanda Knox
item.description: Italy's top court on Tuesday ordered a retrial of American Amanda Knox and a former boyfriend for the murder of British student Meredith Kercher, re-opening a case that prompted harsh criticism of the Italian justice system.

item.title: The FBI's Most Popular Declassified Memo
item.description: Over the past two years, this file has been viewed nearly a million times. Yet, it is only a single page, relaying an unconfirmed report that the FBI never even followed up on.

item.title: George W. Bush Is The Most Expensive Ex-President
item.description: Being the leader of the free world is an expensive proposition. But the costs don't stop once you leave the White House.

item.title: This Epic Accountant Turned Your Dull Excel Spreadsheet Into An Awesome RPG
item.description: A Canadian accountant has built a role playing game (RPG) inside of Excel. It’s called Arena.Xlsm, and it does in fact work.

item.title: The Real Life Models For Your Favorite Disney Characters
item.description: For some Disney characters, actors and models are brought in to act out scenes from the film. These performances are filmed and given to the animators to study and drawn inspiration from. Here are some of the unsung talents who modeled for your favorite Disney characters.

item.title: Do Millennials Stand A Chance In The Real World?
item.description: In the past year or so, data have come in regarding how Generation Y, or the millennials, has adapted to our once-in-a-lifetime financial crisis — the one that battered career prospects, drove hundreds of thousands into the shelter of schools or parents’ basements and left hundreds of thousands of others in continual underemployment.

item.title: Camera Finds Way Back To Owner After Drifting 6,200 Miles From Hawaii To Taiwan
item.description: In 2007, Lindsay Scallan of Newnan, Georgia took her camera — complete with underwater housing — on a trip to Hawaii. It was on that trip, during a nighttime scuba dive in Kaanapali, that Scallan lost her camera to the deep blue. Understandably, she didn’t expect she would ever see it again.

item.title: Two Guys Powerslide Their Way To New World Records For 'Tightest Prallel Parking Job'
item.description: These guys are way better at parking than you are.

item.title: The World's Most Expensive Homes
item.description: A quick rundown of the world's most expensive homes.

item.title: The U.S. Military's Prototype For A Flying Submarine
item.description: Capable of carrying 66 tons of cargo, the Aeroscraft could bring airships back to the skies.

item.title: Kaboom
item.description: They were young and in love and pregnant and partial to heroin and living in a Village apartment with a lot of heavy weaponry lying about. What could possibly go wrong?

item.title: Pack Of 30 Wolves Start Simultaneously Howling In Unison
item.description: Here's a bunch of wolves just deciding to howl together.

item.title: What's So Bad About Extinction, Anyway?
item.description: With all this talk about de-extinction and the apparent desire to bring back no less than 22 defunct species, a number of commentators are starting to ask if extinction is such a bad thing. It's a part of nature, they argue, and one that might even be good for us.

item.title: Ten Amazing Faces Painted On Buildings In Russia
item.description: Maybe Russia is cool after all. Here's ten amazing photos of buildings painted to look like graffiti faces.

item.title: First Pigs, Now China Pulls Thousands Of Dead Ducks From A River
item.description: China has pulled over 1,000 dead ducks from a Sichuan river, while over 16,000 dead pigs have been pulled from a different waterway.

item.title: Five-Year-Old Girl Discovers Fossil Of Previously Unknown Pterosaur
item.description: It’s been a big week in the news for English Kids With Fossils, and a reminder that getting outside and playing in the dirt is still pretty much the best way to use your time.

item.title: Watch This Photoshop Jedi Turn A 16-Bit Super Metroid Screenshot Into A Stunning High-Res Masterpiece
item.description: Photoshop savant and Deviant Art member Elemental79 is back with another mind-blowing timelapse as he turns a screenshot from the 1994 16-bit classic Super Metroid into a high-res work of art.

item.title: Are The Ruins Of The Lost Temple Of Israel Really Hidden In The South Pacific?
item.description: The Internet says the Lost Temple of Israel is hidden in the South Pacific. A reporter went to investigate.

item.title: Daredevil Poses For Vertigo-Inducing Pics While Hanging From Great Heights
item.description: Rather than simply climbing to high locations and photographing his feet on the edge, the 26-year-old man poses for portraits while hanging off edges by his arms and by his legs.

item.title: How To Get Real Eggs At McDonalds
item.description: If you're a fan of McDonald's breakfast sandwiches, this post is a must-read.

item.title: A Missed Goal Of Your Worst Nightmares
item.description: Zestafoni's Boti Demel delivers a stellar entrant for worst miss of all time with his clanger against Merani Martvili during a match in Georgia.

item.title: The 20 Best Trollings In Modern History
item.description: From the Spanish-American War all the way up to the 40 Hottest Women in Tech, the past century has borne witness to some epic trolling, bro.

item.title: What Extremely Successful People Were Doing At Age 25
item.description: Some people know what they want to do from an early age and focus on it relentlessly. Others reinvent themselves, changing careers and industries until they find something that works.

item.title: A Photo That Makes North Korea Look A Lot Less Scary
item.description: Yes, that military equipment does look like an old piano.

item.title: A Comic About People Who Wait Tables
item.description: One day the Oatmeal went to a Red Robin...

item.title: The World As 100 People
item.description: This idea has been around for a while, but it's nice to get an updated look.

item.title: How To Buy A New Computer (If It's 1993)
item.description: This is just trippy.
